titleStmt.title: hEre begynneth the volume intituled and named the recuyell of the historyes of Troye, composed and drawen out of dyuerce bookes of latyn in to frensshe by the ryght venerable persone and worshipfull man. Raoul le ffeure. preest and chapelayn vnto the ryght noble gloryous and myghty prynce in his tyme Phelip duc of Bourgoyne of Braband [et]c in the yere of the incarnacion of our lord god a thousand foure honderd sixty and foure, and translated and drawen out of frenshe in to englisshe by Willyam Caxton mercer of ye cyte of London, at the comau[n]deme[n]t of the right hye myghty and vertuouse pryncesse hys redoubtyd lady. Margarete by the grace of god. Duchesse of Bourgoyne of Lotryk of Braband [et]c., whiche sayd translacion and werke was ... fynysshid in the holy cyte of Colen the. xix. day of septembre the yere of our sayd lord god a thousand foure honderd sixty and enleuen [sic] [et]c ...
Recueil des histoires de Troie. English
titleStmt.author: Lefèvre, Raoul, fl. 1460.

titleStmt.title: hEre begynneth the volume intituled and named the recuyell of the historyes of Troye, composed and drawen out of dyuerce bookes of latyn in to frensshe by the ryght venerable persone and worshipfull man. Raoul le ffeure. preest and chapelayn vnto the ryght noble gloryous and myghty prynce in his tyme Phelip duc of Bourgoyne of Braband [et]c in the yere of the incarnacion of our lord god a thousand foure honderd sixty and foure, and translated and drawen out of frenshe in to englisshe by Willyam Caxton mercer of ye cyte of London, at the comau[n]deme[n]t of the right hye myghty and vertuouse pryncesse hys redoubtyd lady. Recueil des histoires de Troie. English
titleStmt.author: Lefèvre, Raoul, fl. 1460.
Caxton, William, ca. 1422-1491.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by William Caxton and, probably, Colard Mansion,

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Recueil des histoires de Troye.
Title from ¹[A]2r, which is printed in red.
Imprint from STC and Needham; see also Lotte Hellinga, "Caxton in focus", p. 38-9, 48.
Signatures: [A-O¹⁰ P; A-I¹⁰ K L⁶; A-K¹⁰].
[A]3r text begins: and zeland and thus whan alle thyse thynges cam ..
The last leaf contains 14 lines of Latin verse beginning: Pergama flere volo. fata danais data solo ..
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
